title: 111_hr2365
content: The "Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers Act of 2009" mandates the Bureau of Labor Statistics to create a monthly index reflecting spending changes for individuals aged 62 and above in the U.S. Appropriations are authorized for this purpose, with the effective date starting from July 31 of the year following the Act's enactment. Amendments to Title II of the Social Security Act include adjusting the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers for individuals aged 62 and above receiving monthly insurance benefits. Amendments to Title II of the Social Security Act involve adjusting the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers for individuals aged 62 and above receiving monthly insurance benefits. The amendments include inserting new provisions related to the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers Act. The amendments made to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve adjusting the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers for individuals aged 62 and above receiving monthly insurance benefits. The effective date for these changes is specified to apply to determinations made with respect to cost-of-living computation quarters ending on or after September 30 of the second calendar year following the calendar year in which the Act is enacted. The amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve adjusting the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers for individuals aged 62 and above receiving monthly insurance benefits. The cap amount for accounting years ending after October 1 of the second calendar year following the Act's enactment is determined by the percentage increase or decrease in the medical care expenditure category of the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers. The amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve adjusting the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers for individuals aged 62 and above receiving monthly insurance benefits. This includes updating various sections to reference the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers instead of the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers. The amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve updating sections to reference the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers instead of the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers in various subparagraphs and sections. The amendments to Title XVIII of the Social Security Act involve updating sections to reference the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers instead of the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers in various subparagraphs and sections. This includes changes in section 1842(s)(1), section 1860D-14(a)(3), section 1860D-14(a)(4)(A), and section 1882(p)(11)(C)(ii). The amendments involve updating sections to reference the Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers instead of the Consumer Price Index for All Urban Consumers in various subparagraphs and sections of Title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The effective date for these changes is determined by the calendar year in which the Act was enacted.
